summary: Ktar, re: Blockbench Plugin
mainText:
'Absolutely awesome blog post covering in high detail how to make Hytale art. Man this is a beautiful post. Great work Mr Frick 
@ThomasFrick'

summary: Polina, re: Blockbench Plugin
mainText: 'Blockbench plugin for Hytale is out and we have a tutorial to kick start your creations!'

summary: Slikey, re: Model Blogpost
mainText:
'Getting this out before Christmas was a big task. This was only possible due to the incredible dedication of Jannis from 
@blockbench, @KannoArt and our beloved artists!
This Plugin simply did not exist when we got Hytale back. 

We worked hard to abandon our internal Model Editor and join our community on their preferred tool.

I know there is a lot more work to be done and we will continue on making this Plugin great, but this was what we consider an MVP (minimum viable product).

The Plugin is release under GPL-3 Open Source. Enjoy the holidays, absorb the lesson from @ThomasFrick and on January 13: Import your work into the game.'

summary: Scooter, re: Model Blogpost
mainText:
'üé® Here's a comprehensive guide to creating models in Hytale's unique art style.

From our custom Blockbench plugin to texture techniques and modeling principles, Thomas shares the foundations that will help you bring your creative visions to life.'

summary: Thomas, re: lack of base player model being released
mainText: 'We know...Base player model is a complicated topic. It's composed of so many detached parts and it's still being polished as we speak. The lack of documentation on how to attach things properly with the plugin will make it confusing for everyone, so it'll come later, sorry üòî'

summary: Thomas, re: user jokingly saying they won't follow this style
mainText: 'I'm really serious when I say that rules are made to be broken. Use the guide so you know what the engine expects and what we do internally. Then break the rules and try your own stuff! Art is exploration!'

summary: Thomas, re: Jannis announcing Blockbench supports Hytale

summary: Thomas, re: nothing being perfect
mainText: 'Also, it's a huge team work. Many talented artists have worked on making this in such way :)'

summary: Slikey, re: no external tools/mods required for server moderation
mainText: 'I wouldn't say no external tools or mods required - I can definitely see someone making a proper "Server Mod" panel and make it a standalone plugin. We really only have some basic commands.'

summary: Slikey, re: server moderation tools
mainText: 'Whitelist, Bans and Permissions for sure - don't have the source in front of me for the other moderation relevant features.'

summary: Simon, re: Hytale being WIP
mainText: 'The game we have today versus 4 months ago is actually insane. If we keep this up for 2-3 years it‚Äôs going to be incredible. Very excited.'

summary: Simon, re: transparency
mainText: 'Im hiding all of the major controversial changes to the game, I mean, yes thank you'

summary: Simon, re: zone name decisions
mainText:
'These names were decided in less than 2 minutes! 

There are 1000+ decisions made per day to hit release date, we don‚Äôt have the luxury of time and be paralyzed by decisions!

However, I did spend a bit of time replying on X about this issue. To be fair, it‚Äôs when I‚Äôm away from PC/Laptop and I think its important to vibe check and see how far I can push my transparency. TBH no one should be worried that I start ghosting, I need this interaction to gauge some future decisions.'

summary: Paris, re: user defending the usage of AI in the GirlsWhoCode program
mainText:
'I agree that there should be awareness and training and resources on how to use AI tools/platforms for programming but I don't think this is the right approach at all.

I am pretty sure most if not all the content in this bundle is AI-generated courses.'

(Image)

summary: Simon, re: user thinking Simon might sell again

Now I get to finish Hytale, so it's the best of both worlds.

No more boring retirement.'

I think it's an interesting take for this game genre, I think it will serve us well to do big content drops'

summary: Simon provides more info on the Zones
mainText:
'Emerald Wilds (3 Regions, several biomes)
Howling Sands (3 Regions, several biomes)
Whisperfrost Frontiers (3 Regions, several biomes)
Devastated Lands (2 Regions, several biomes)

Regions are a bundle of biomes; we can treat them as "tiers" of difficulty in a way, even though right now, the difficulty is somewhat not that steep between the tiers.

Some screenshots of what happens when you discover a new region, see how the Zone is displayed at the top and Region in gold text:'

(Four Images attached, showing in-game pop-up for new region discovery.)

summary: Paris, re: GirlsWhoCode supporting VibeCoding
mainText:
'This is pretty upsetting to see, thanks for raising awareness Kenney.

I really hate how this is being marketed too, very intentional.
"Lovable" Vibe Coding.

I'm pretty confident this would just be AI generated content to learn how to generate more AI generated content üôÉ'

summary: Simon, re: Myne's explanation
mainText:
'Why are you making assumptions that I did not take community feedback? The official names are based almost entirely on the feedback we received in the last 5 days. Z3, we decided to go a bit more fantasy, given how the zone feels and how detached Borea would feel, that's all.

I took all the feedback into account. In fact, the real name for Z4 was not this one internally before asking for feedback. I went with Devastated Lands.

Borea was the one that got the most concern, both internally and externally, as it was clashing with our biome names and future world gen 2 plans.

Here are some screenshots I sent to my team when that was happening.'

summary: Simon, re: Myne asking why change something the community agreed on
mainText:
'What do you mean, the community agreed? 

this is getting crazy, do you want us to stay transparent our keep quiet with our changes lol'

summary: Simon, re: Myne asking why rename the zones
mainText:
'There were no names in-game.
It was literally named Zone1_Tier1_Biome
Worse, in the assets it had a wrong old name Grasslands
And in the blogs/posts they said Zone 1 or Grasslands or Emerald Grove (Grove didn't make sense because of some of the biomes).'

summary: Simon, re: creating rift in community
mainText:
'I knew the Zone 3 rename would cause some resistance; it's a bit of a test of the community's tolerance for change.  The game they imagine Hytale to be is probably completely different from what it is in reality, and some significant changes will be required to make it a good game after launch.

We are not planning to please everyone, because that would result in a generic, boring game.

Some will appreciate, some will not!

This is not Minecraft.'

summary: Simon, re: Hawkon saying they'll be calling Z3 'Borea' forever
mainText: 'but then if there's a biome named Borea you gonna confuse everyone lolol'

summary: Simon, re: Acorn suggesting different names for Z3
mainText: 'no, it's time to move on brother, there are 10000 other decisions to make, if we waste more time on names we are gonna end up where the game was before: cancelled lol'

summary: Simon, re: why change the familiar
mainText: 'the game was not released, everything is subject to change'

summary: Simon, re: Zone Names
mainText: 'yes final, some old names are used for regions/biomes instead'

summary: Simon, re: missing the 'Borea' name
mainText: 'can be used for regions/biomes, doesnt matter'

summary: Simon, re: Zone names
mainText:
'Emerald Wilds
Howling Sands
Whisperfrost Frontiers
Devastated Lands'

summary: Simon - Hytale Jobs
mainText:
'Getting a lot of messages about hiring for Hytale!

We‚Äôre focused on launch and don‚Äôt want to bring people in without giving them the time they deserve to be properly welcomed! We will open roles right after, and yes, fully remote, no relocation. 

If you‚Äôve spent years contributing to this game genre (mods, tools, art, design, engineering), keep an eye out. That‚Äôs the kind of background we value. I don't care if you worked in a big studio or never had any "real" job; show us what you have done for the game genre, that's what we care about!'

summary: Simon, re: Path of Exile elements he'd consider adding to Hytale
mainText:
'I like their gems system in PoE2, allows people to be creative with their setup.
Imagine you could modify a bow to do ricochet arrows and it up with multi shot etc

This is very long term. Maybe never gonna happen, but would be fun to experiment! At least I would mod it lol'

summary: Simon, re: benefits of no character-based progression
mainText: 'Allows friends to join in and give them gear, no need to grind to artificially catch up'
